main event: An unidentified object was observed traveling as a solid stream of yellow to white sparks, descending to the north-northeast for 6-8 seconds before changing direction abruptly to the southeast and disappearing.
interesting points: The object appeared to climb as it disappeared.
The entire flight of the object was under cloud cover.
The object was described as a trail of fire.
The report was forwarded by E. J. Ruppelt, Chief of Safety, to a person named STD (TSgt) C.H. Patterson M.D. in Ohio.
The report includes details about the flight path, maneuvers, and disappearance of the object.
sighted object: A trail of yellow to white sparks
photographs: No photographs are included in the report.
